intent_atoms.description: Integrate FoundationUI into ISOInspectorApp gradually, starting with small components and scaling up.
Maintain backward compatibility so old and new UI coexist during integration.
All phase tasks complete before proceeding to next phase.
Unit tests pass with coverage ≥80% per phase.
Snapshot regression tests pass on all platforms.
Zero SwiftLint violations after code review.
Performance baselines met with no regressions.
FoundationUI components must be fully tested before integration.
No magic numbers; all design tokens used from FoundationUI.
Use a phased 6‑phase integration roadmap (Phases 0–6) with quality gates.
Implement a testing pyramid: 70% unit, 20% integration, 10% E2E.
Adopt WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance as cross‑cutting requirement.
Support macOS/iOS/iPadOS platforms with platform‑aware adaptations.
Document integration patterns and success criteria in FoundationUI_Integration_Strategy.md.

functional_units.name: FoundationUI Integration Strategy Document
functional_units.description: Detailed phased roadmap for integrating FoundationUI into ISOInspectorApp, including phases, subtasks, testing strategy, quality metrics, and risk assessment.

functional_units.name: Phase 0 Setup & Verification Tasks
functional_units.description: Initial setup tasks such as adding FoundationUI dependency, creating integration test suite, building component showcase, documenting patterns, and updating design system guide.

functional_units.name: Phase 1 Foundation Components Integration
functional_units.description: Integration of core FoundationUI components into the app with unit tests, snapshot tests, accessibility checks, and performance baselines.

functional_units.name: Phase 2 Interactive Components Integration
functional_units.description: Adding interactive FoundationUI components to the app, ensuring functionality across platforms and compliance with testing and accessibility standards.

functional_units.name: Phase 3 Layout Patterns Implementation
functional_units.description: Implementing layout patterns from FoundationUI, including complex UI arrangements, with comprehensive testing and performance monitoring.

functional_units.name: Phase 4 Platform Adaptation
functional_units.description: Adapting FoundationUI components for macOS, iOS, and iPadOS specific behaviors such as keyboard shortcuts, hover effects, and layout differences.

functional_units.name: Phase 5 Advanced Features Integration
functional_units.description: Incorporating advanced FoundationUI features like documentation, QA hooks, and extended component capabilities into the app.

functional_units.name: Phase 6 Full Integration & Validation
functional_units.description: Final integration phase validating all components, running full test suite, ensuring WCAG 2.1 AA compliance, performance budgets, and publishing migration guide.

functional_units.name: Integration Test Suite
functional_units.description: Automated tests covering unit, snapshot, accessibility, performance, and integration scenarios for FoundationUI integration.

functional_units.name: Component Showcase Application
functional_units.description: A showcase app demonstrating all integrated FoundationUI components for development velocity and testing.

functional_units.name: Design System Architecture Documentation
functional_units.description: Technical spec section detailing FoundationUI layers, integration patterns, quality metrics, and platform adaptations.

functional_units.name: Accessibility Audit Tooling
functional_units.description: Automated accessibility tests ensuring WCAG 2.1 AA compliance across all platforms.

functional_units.name: Performance Monitoring Suite
functional_units.description: Tools and tests measuring app launch time, tree scroll FPS, memory usage to enforce performance budgets.

functional_units.name: Documentation Updates (next_tasks.md, Summary_of_Work.md)
functional_units.description: Updated task queues and project status documents reflecting integration plan progress.
